intro: Dimeria ornithopoda var. khasiana, commonly known as the Khasi dimeria, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky terrains. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in humid, subtropical climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
